T\-O\-D\-O\-: D\-O\-C \hypertarget{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_test_suite_a3d9c8c7f0ff3f7b1f74717abc747b3fd}{\index{chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite@{chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite}!register\-Test\-Units@{register\-Test\-Units}}

\subsubsection[{register\-Test\-Units}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}virtual void chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite\-::register\-Test\-Units (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [pure virtual]}}}\label{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_test_suite_a3d9c8c7f0ff3f7b1f74717abc747b3fd}


Member function intended to be overridden to register unit tests within this suite. 

This function will be called once the \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_launch_pad}{Launch\-Pad} has constructed an instance of this object. This process should not perform an actions that can fail, simply register subsequent \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_test_unit}{Test\-Unit} objects.

\begin{DoxyAttention}{Attention}
This function is abstract so must be overridden. 
\end{DoxyAttention}
\hypertarget{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_test_suite_ad0a1e7224769042c7ef55c1cd6192982}{\index{chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite@{chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite}!setup@{setup}}
\index{setup@{setup}!chaos::test::TestSuite@{chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite}}
\subsubsection[{setup}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite\-::setup (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [virtual]}}}\label{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_test_suite_ad0a1e7224769042c7ef55c1cd6192982}


Member function intended to be overridden to setup the fixture for this suite. 

This function will be called just before the \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_test_unit}{Test\-Unit} objects registered by this suite are run. This function should not perform actions that can suffer from critical failure, but may fail to setup the environment.

T\-O\-D\-O\-: how to deal with failure? Exception or function call, bool return \hypertarget{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_test_suite_a6ff5bccbbc0f6590f9c921734ed40029}{\index{chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite@{chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite}!teardown@{teardown}}
\index{teardown@{teardown}!chaos::test::TestSuite@{chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite}}
\subsubsection[{teardown}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void chaos\-::test\-::\-Test\-Suite\-::teardown (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [virtual]}}}\label{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_test_suite_a6ff5bccbbc0f6590f9c921734ed40029}


Member function intended to be overridden to clean up the fixture setup by this suite. 

This function will be called after execution of all \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1test_1_1_test_unit}{Test\-Unit} objects registered by this suite have finished execution, whether or not they have executed successfully. This function should not risk critical failure, but may fail to clean up the environment.

T\-O\-D\-O\-: how to deal with failure?
